com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.centralized

Class CentralizedTopologyMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.AbstractPhysicalTopologyMonitor
      • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.centralized.CentralizedTopologyMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMessageListener, IDistributedApplicationRegistry, IPhysicalTopology, IPhysicalTopologyMonitor, java.lang.Runnable

    public class CentralizedTopologyMonitor
extends AbstractPhysicalTopologyMonitor
implements IPhysicalTopologyMonitor, IMessageListener, java.lang.Runnable

    • Constructor Detail

      • CentralizedTopologyMonitor

        protected CentralizedTopologyMonitor(boolean isCentral,
                          java.lang.String centralIPAddr,
                          int port,
                          int heartBeatMsecs)
        This is intended primarily for testing, #CentalizedTopologyMonitor(String, int, int) should generally be used instead. This allows us to define two of these on the same host that talk to each other. One of the two passes in isCentral=true, the other iCentral=false.
        Parameters:
        isCentral -
        centralIPAddr -
        port -
        heartBeatMsecs -

      • CentralizedTopologyMonitor

        public CentralizedTopologyMonitor(java.lang.String centralIPAddr,
                          int port,
                          int heartBeatMsecs)
        Define the instance as either a central or leaf instance.
        Parameters:
        centralIPAddr - if this is null, then this instance is the central station, otherwise this is a leaf and the given address is where the central station can be reached.
        port - port on which the central station is listening.
        heartBeatMsecs -

      • getReachablePeers

        public java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getReachablePeers(IApplicationDescriptor app,
                                                      int hops)
        Description copied from interface: IPhysicalTopology
        Get the list of peers that are reachable within the given number of hops.
        Specified by:
        getReachablePeers in interface IPhysicalTopology
        hops - the number of network links to traverse. 0 or larger, where 0 means peers on the same host (i.e. without a hop between NICs).
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty. The returned set does not include the given descriptor.

                        java.net.URI recvr)
                          throws DSMException
        Description copied from interface: IDistributedApplicationRegistry
        Register this URI with the given app. The combination of app name space and instance id should be unique within the registry.
        Specified by:
        register in interface IDistributedApplicationRegistry
        Parameters:
        app - app descriptor includes name space and instance id.
        recvr - URI that can be used to send tuples.
        Returns:
        a unique cookie for this registration or null if could not be stored.

        DSMException

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws DSMException
        Description copied from interface: IDistributedApplicationRegistry
        Stop the registry. Any dynamic registrations that happen betweeen IDistributedApplicationRegistry.start() and IDistributedApplicationRegistry.stop() should be cleared from the registry so that the registry is effectively in its initialized stated.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface IDistributedApplicationRegistry
